intro: Adonanthe, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and red or purple flowers that have five petals. Adonanthe is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies. Its unique appearance and blooming time make it a notable ornamental plant in gardens.
